imp.core.structures

Class PositionMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • imp.core.structures.PositionMatrix

  • public class PositionMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a specialized 4x4 matrix. The 4th row and column are known constants. Represents a position matrix of a body or joint.
    Version:
    1.21
    Author:
    kemmannl dykstran klehmc

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PositionMatrix()
      Defines a 4x4 matrix filled with the identity values.
      PositionMatrix(double[][] values)
      Defines a 4x4 matrix filled with the specified values.
      PositionMatrix(Jama.Matrix matrix)
      Creates a 4x4 matrix from the Jama matrix passed in.
      PositionMatrix(PositionMatrix posMtx)
      Creates a new position matrix that is a copy of the matrix passed in.

      Create a shallow copy of this matrix.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PositionMatrix

        public PositionMatrix()
        Defines a 4x4 matrix filled with the identity values.

      • PositionMatrix

        public PositionMatrix(double[][] values)
        Defines a 4x4 matrix filled with the specified values. The last row of any matrix used in IMP is {0,0,0,1}. The last column will also be {0,0,0,1}.
        Parameters:
        values - the values with which to populate the matrix.

      • PositionMatrix

        public PositionMatrix(Jama.Matrix matrix)
        Creates a 4x4 matrix from the Jama matrix passed in.
        Parameters:
        matrix - the Jama matrix to create this position matrix from.

      • PositionMatrix

        public PositionMatrix(PositionMatrix posMtx)
        Creates a new position matrix that is a copy of the matrix passed in.
        Parameters:
        posMtx - the position matrix used to create this position matrix from.

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public PositionMatrix copy()
        Create a shallow copy of this matrix.
        Returns:
        a copy of this matrix.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(PositionMatrix pm)
        Compares two matrices for equality with the error tolerance constraint.
        Parameters:
        pm - the PositionMatrix to compare to.
        Returns:
        true if the matrices' values match, false otherwise.

      • equalsEpsilon

        public boolean equalsEpsilon(PositionMatrix pm,
                    double epsilon)
        Compares two matrices for equality with the specifed error tolerance constraint.
        Parameters:
        pm - the PositionMatrix to compare to.
        epsilon - the maximum allowed difference between values.
        Returns:
        true if the matrices' values match, false otherwise.

      • fill

        public void fill(Vector3 col1,
        Vector3 col2,
        Vector3 col3,
        Vector3 col4)
        Set the first 3 rows of each column with vector values. The last row in a position matrix is a constant value in IMP and so cannot be set.
        Parameters:
        col1 - the first column of the position matrix.
        col2 - the second column of the position matrix.
        col3 - the third column of the position matrix.
        col4 - the fourth column of the position matrix.

      • get

        public double get(int row,
         int column)
        Returns the value at the specified row and column.
        Parameters:
        row - the row in the matrix (0-based).
        column - the column in the matrix (0-based).
        Returns:
        the element at the specified row and column.

      • getColumn

        public Vector3 getColumn(int column)
        Returns the i-th column from the 4x3 sub-matrix. (The 4th row is known to be [0,0,0,1]).
        Parameters:
        column - The column to retrieve (0 based).
        Returns:
        a Vector3 representation of the the column.

      • getJamaMatrix

        public Jama.Matrix getJamaMatrix()
        Gets the underlying Jama matrix for this position matrix.
        Returns:
        the Jama matrix.

      • getRow

        public Vector3 getRow(int row)
        Returns the i-th row from the 4x3 sub-matrix. (The 4th row is known to be [0,0,0,1]).
        Parameters:
        row - the row index to return (0-based).
        Returns:
        the i-th row from the 4x3 sub-matrix as a Vector3.

      • inverse

        public PositionMatrix inverse()
        Returns the inverse of this matrix.
        Returns:
        the inverse of this matrix.

      • multiply

        public PositionMatrix multiply(PositionMatrix matrix)
        Multiply this position matrix by another position matrix and return the resulting position matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - the position matrix to multiply this one with.
        Returns:
        the product of the two position matrices.

      • multiply

        public Vector3 multiply(Vector3 vector)
        Multiplies this matrix by a 4-dimensional vector (last element implied to be 0).
        Parameters:
        vector - the vector to multiply by.
        Returns:
        the product of this matrix and the vector (last element implied to be 0).

      • set

        public void set(int row,
       int column,
       double value)
        Set the element value at the specified row and column. Does not allow the user to set the values in the last row.
        Parameters:
        row - the row in the matrix (0-based).
        column - the column in the matrix (0-based).
        value - the value to set in the matrix.

      • setColumn

        public void setColumn(int column,
             Vector3 data)
        Set the column with the Vector3 data.
        Parameters:
        column - the column data to set.
        data - the Vector3 which holds the data.

      • setJamaMatrix

        public void setJamaMatrix(Jama.Matrix m)
        Set this position matrix's underlying Jama matrix.
        Parameters:
        m - the Jama matrix to set this position matrix to.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toFloatArray

        public float[] toFloatArray()
        Converts this position matrix into an array.
        Returns:
        an array of floating point numbers.

      • trace

        public double trace()
        The trace is the sum of the main diagonal, from the upper left to the lower right.
        Returns:
        the sum of the main diagonal.

      • transpose

        public PositionMatrix transpose()
        Get the transpose of this matrix.
        Returns:
        the transposed matrix.
